source_caption_data.pre_caption: This scenery shot begins with a high-angle wide shot, looking directly down the center of a multi-story building's interior atrium. The walls of the upper floors frame the shot on all sides, creating a receding perspective toward the bottom of the atrium, which is positioned in the center background. The camera then plunges rapidly downward. This movement causes the surrounding walls and light fixtures to streak with motion blur, radiating from the center of the frame. As the camera descends, the lower floor, initially in the distant background, rushes toward the foreground, briefly revealing a poster and an exit sign in the center before the entire frame is consumed by the blur of motion, effectively transitioning to an extreme close-up on the rapidly approaching surface.

If **shot size or spatial position** changes, describe how these transitions occur clearly, specifying both the **initial and final states**.

In addition, the human-written captions below already describe the subjects (if any) and the scenery in this video but do not capture their spatial composition and movements.
